document_title: Warts on the feet (soles): Causes, signs, prevention
subsection_content:
Are not. Warts are usually harmless. However, warts can be transmitted from one person to another through direct contact with wart secretions (by touching, shaking hands, having sex...) and by sharing personal items in the family ( shaving table, towel, toilet, bathtub...). More dangerously, warts can spread from one area to another on the patient's body, causing skin damage and pain.
The conditions to decide whether a wart is dangerous do not depend on the location of the wart. In particular, genital warts are listed as one of the dangerous diseases for society, causing many health effects, and can even cause cancer, directly threatening the patient's life.
In addition, if warts appear on the face, limbs and other parts, it will cause the skin to become infected, lose its aesthetics, and affect daily activities and work.

mun coc o chan.json. Are foot warts dangerous?
Are not. Warts are usually harmless. However, warts can be transmitted from one person to another through direct contact with wart secretions (by touching, shaking hands, having sex...) and by sharing personal items in the family ( shaving table, towel, toilet, bathtub...). More dangerously, warts can spread from one area to another on the patient's body, causing skin damage and pain.
The conditions to decide whether a wart is dangerous do not depend on the location of the wart. In particular, genital warts are listed as one of the dangerous diseases for society, causing many health effects, and can even cause cancer, directly threatening the patient's life.
In addition, if warts appear on the face, limbs and other parts, it will cause the skin to become infected, lose its aesthetics, and affect daily activities and work.
